Regulatory Strategy Advisor

Company Name nbn™ Australia Company Location North Sydney, Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Are you a great communicator, quick learner and the type of individual who thrives in an environment where change and innovation are at the forefront of everything we do? If so, and you are looking for your next opportunity then nbn has a fantastic opportunity for an Advisor within our Regulatory Strategy team in Sydney, Melbourne or Canberra.

Reporting to the General Manager, Competition, Policy and Regulation, Regulatory Strategy this is a broad role where you will get to advise internal stakeholders as well as work with external stakeholders such as regulators, policy makers, industry, consumer groups and Government.




A bit about your role

 Outlined below are the core duties that the Regulatory Strategy Advisor will be responsible for delivering:

  • Work with the business to identify and analyse any regulatory issues.
  • Provide guidance and education on nbn regulatory matters for internal stakeholders.
  • Provide the business with guidance and education on regulatory matters and ensure internal stakeholders have a clear understanding of their obligations.
  • Contribute to strategic projects to secure favourable regulatory reform for nbn.
  • Assist with developing public and confidential submissions on a range of regulatory and policy matters.
  • Monitor and maintain compliance where appropriate with legislation, standards, frameworks, policies, procedures and controls to ensure that internal stakeholders have an understanding and comply.



A bit about you

 The successful candidate will ideally come from a legal, economics, public policy or finance background and have a couple of years' experience working in a similar role within a regulated industry. You're an exceptional communicator with the ability to think strategically, highly organised and have a track record of building and maintaining collaborative working relationships with a wide range of internal and external of stakeholders. You will also be curious, adaptable, and thrive in an atmosphere of change.



Life at nbn


At nbn you'll be joining a team that believes there is strength in diversity and opportunity through inclusion. We're building an inclusive and diverse workplace where different perspectives, thinking and skills are valued and people are supported to achieve their potential. We're committed to our goal of increasing the presence of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the business and have a focus on increasing diversity amongst our leadership teams.




Continue the conversation


If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.


nbn is a fast moving organisation with lots to deliver - so we may not always wait until the job ad expires before reviewing applications. As a result, you should submit your application as soon as possible!


At nbn our people and our planet matter. We have an unwavering commitment to the wellbeing and safety of our employees so that everyone goes home safely each day and can perform at their peak to deliver the nbn™ network. nbn also aims to build a network that minimises energy use and can be operated with minimal impact on the environment.

Learning & Development Partner (6 month contract)

Company Name THE ICONIC Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 79 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

THE ICONIC is a truly unique brand. We entered the market in 2011 with the vision of defining the future of fashion retail. Since then we have created a brand known throughout Australia by connecting 20-35yr old shoppers with the best fashion and sports product through the most inspiring and rewarding shopping experience.


THE ICONIC stands for benchmark-setting experiences (3HR delivery, access to over 700 top brands, market-leading shopping app), for impassioned communities (connecting Australians fashion and sports lovers through digital innovation), and for our love of the newest in fashion from our 700+ leading local and international brands. We want to inspire Australians and New Zealanders to constantly explore new sides of their identity, and have a whole lot of fun doing it.


  • “We Dream Big” – “You will challenge the status quo, bringing passion, innovation and creativity to the wider ICONIC team.
  • “We Are True to our Customers” – you will be inherently passionate about customer impact, both external and internal customers, and will constantly challenge yourself and the team to deliver more customer value
  • “We Get Things Done” – you do not want to work in a cumbersome organisation, you want to work in an agile high-growth company. You lead with the right balance of planning and pragmatism.
  • “We are Stronger Together”\xa0- You will be part of an experienced team working collaboratively to inspire the broader organisation towards a united vision.


About the Role


At THE ICONIC, as our company grows, so do our people. The L&D Partner is a part of the People & Culture team - our aspiration is to deliver an impactful, memorable and progressive employee experience that reflects and drives our unique culture and brand.

Our culture of learning is an environment that supports and encourages the collective discovery, sharing and application of knowledge, helping us to continually improve, achieve goals and attain new possibilities, #weneverstoplearning.


We’re looking for a dynamic, self-starting L&D Partner with a balanced skill set of design and delivery. Both are equally critical to the success of our start-up L&D environment - we get our hands dirty! Whilst initially a 6 month contract, there’s potential for permanency for a superstar addition to THE ICONIC team.


What’s the scope?


Develop and deliver inspiring learning experiences and content to help our 800+ ICONIC employees thrive. Specifically focused on building practical tools and content to support the development of management skills and leadership basics.


Back it up with evidence-based research and science, leverage social channels to build community, take responsibility for the end-to-end delivery of learning initiatives and contribute to increasing our employee engagement score - all to liberate our employees to be the best version of themselves.


What does success look like?


  • Learning solutions are progressive, pragmatic and engaging for our teams
  • Tools are practical, relevant, flexible and scalable across all business areas
  • Content for our core leadership program is built, clearly aligned to our Leadership Principles
  • All People Leaders have access to the ‘brilliant basics’ and know how to implement them
  • Content for our ‘always on’ feedback model is built and embedded across all areas
  • L&D processes and solutions are increasingly digitised (where digital is most impactful)
  • Employees are aware of, and can access, the learning solutions they need
  • Our knowledge-sharing programs achieve increasing participation and value for employees
  • Our employee engagement score (specifically L&D measures) continues to drive upwards


How you’ll succeed


  • Working closely with key partners across different teams and sites, to develop the most impactful solutions for learning requests and needs
  • Working closely with the Learning & Development Lead and wider P&C team to ensure L&D initiatives are engaging, relevant and measurable
  • Ensuring quality, effectiveness and accountability to THE ICONIC culture, standards and process excellence
  • Using data insights to shape and support our content, processes and approach
  • Continuing to foster a culture of cross-organisational collaboration, team-based learning, whole-self focus and experimentation


What it takes


  • Strong instructional design skills, based on adult learning principles
  • Experience in the delivery of L&D tools and programs
  • Demonstrated experience in developing content for fundamental management skills
  • Competency with design tools such as Articulate 360 and Adobe Creative Cloud apps
  • Graphic design skills/great design sensibility is highly desirable
  • Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving and decision making based on data
  • Ability to communicate effectively and adapt style, based on differing audiences
  • Ability to manage priorities and thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • An agile, continuous improvement mindset
  • A people-focused, user-centric approach
  • Ability to present and facilitate comfortably (although not a primary focus of the role)
  • Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information
  • Full Australian work rights

Change Lead Consultant

Company Name Guild Group Company Location Sydney

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 113 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us


Guild Group is the parent company of four key business units – Guild Insurance, Acerta, Guild Trustee Services and Meridian Lawyers. Our Finance, Technology, Human Resources and Risk, Audit and Compliance divisions partner with these businesses to deliver their strategy. We are a values driven organisation with a genuine, friendly and collaborative culture that respects, rewards and values input and innovation from all levels of the business. We’re a nimble and dynamic business with big aspirations in a build and grow phase, and we seek talented specialists to join us on our journey.


The Role


In this highly visible project assignment, you will be responsible for the delivery of operational change across our businesses supporting Claims servicing and the provision of legal advice. With your outstanding ability to facilitate, identify, resolve, design and implement change, your skills will be utilised spanning two different businesses. Specifically, in this change program, you will deliver improvements to our ways of working including service delivery, operating cost, claims cost management and providing exceptional customer experience. Your experience gained in operational change programs will set you in good stead to identify further opportunities and deliver in solutions to support best practice and bring these initiatives to life. You will bring demonstrated experience gained in Insurance and will work directly with our business executives to lead, facilitate and drive all change improvement initiatives.
This will include guidance around prioritisation, capability and delivery governance across our businesses. Your accountabilities will include:


•\xa0prioritising, planning and tracking change program
•\xa0designing and producing documentation pertaining to change
•\xa0creating and implementing change plan utilising our group change leadership framework
•\xa0assisting and supporting teams on the change journey
•\xa0providing update reports to operations and governance teams
•\xa0providing effective leadership
•\xa0coordinating all activity and tracking against deliverable timeframe
•\xa0preparing timely, meaningful and effective communications


About You


You are a highly experienced Change Manager, experienced in transformational programs. You are well known for your consultative approach and influencing skills across C-suite, operations and cross functional supporting teams within complex or matrixed businesses. Your demonstrated experience in project managing, prioritisation, planning resourcing design, implementation and embedding change will ensure your success in this 6-month assignment. You will have a high degree of flexibility developed in consulting or transformational projects and will provide highly effective process re-engineering and a seamless transition to new ways of working. With our customers at the core of everything we do, your focus on delivering excellent outcomes and providing the structure for our growth is crucial. Based in Sydney, Travel to Melbourne will be also a requirement of this role.


Next Steps


If you would like to be a part of our growth story and work across businesses that value your effort, celebrate your\xa0achievements\xa0and encourage you to achieve personal and company success, please apply.

884161782:
[

Senior Customer Insights Analyst

Company Name Medibank Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 116 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are Medibank – an integrated healthcare company providing private health insurance and health solutions to 3.7 million Australians.

\xa0

At Medibank we stand for better health for better lives.

\xa0

About Us

We're passionate about nurturing careers.

\xa0

We support new innovation and thinking, and openly collaborate and share new ideas. We're healthy and active in our lives and wellbeing is encouraged at every level. Our people play an important role in the future of health and healthcare and we believe that working together, we're stronger.


The Medibank Health Solutions division is a leading provider of Australian healthcare and human services. Working in partnership with business, government and non-government organisations, Medibank Health Solutions delivers vital health and human services to diverse client populations.

\xa0

The Opportunity

As our Senior Customer Insights Analyst you will be responsible for providing analysis and insights across a number of customer programs provided by Medibank Health Solutions (MHS). The role will require you to provide customer reporting, customer analytics, management reporting, and industry and customer insights. The purpose of these insights is to support ongoing business growth, high quality customer engagement and business retention objectives of MHS. In this role you will work closely with the Head of Sales Enablement to support business decision making based on sound analysis.

\xa0

Key responsibilities include:

  • Providing analysis on MHS customer programs that involves analysis of program utilisation, costs and trends;
  • Advanced Customer reporting including automation, data visualisation and key Program insights to our Customers (Government, not for profit, NGO, and enterprise);
  • Analysing program benefits including both ROI and qualitative benefits delivered by MHS programs;
  • Researching and reviewing relevant health and human service models across Australia and internationally;
  • Delivering data and financial modelling of models of service delivery (including alternative models) to produce recommendations for implementation of Customer contracts; and
  • Identifying innovative approaches to health and human service delivery for consideration by internal stakeholders.

\xa0

About You

You have extensive experience in customer analysis, evaluation and/or modelling of health and human services data, and market research. You hold achievements and experience in advanced statistical, economic and/or other quantitative analysis. You present with customer facing experience and the capability in creating engaging and effective analysis artefacts including reports, papers and presentations. Familiarity with Australian Data Standards and health datasets and demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the Australian health and human service sectors and policy context. A tertiary qualification in a health sciences, economics, mathematics, statistics, public health or other related discipline is essential.


Key skills required for the role:

  • Experience and ability to undertake complex data and statistical analysis (including multivariate analyses) using relevant tools (eg R, Python, Tableau);
  • Management of large datasets to ensure integrity, quality, accuracy and privacy of data for analysis;
  • Understanding of research and program evaluation principles and methodologies; and
  • Ability to develop high impact written communications and deliver succinct verbal communications to an executive level audience.

\xa0

What We Offer

In return for your hard work we offer a range of great benefits, including subsidised private health insurance, travel insurance and pet insurance. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.


Medibank is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.


A Career at Medibank adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health.


For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply.


For a confidential discussion, please email Lucy.Ribon@medibank.com.au


Please note, if this position attracts a large volume of interest, the closing date for applications may be brought forward. With this in mind, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.

Job description

We are looking for a Data Science Team Lead to lead a small team of Data Scientists for one of our AI focused clients based in Sydney CBD.


This business is a well established start-up that has been backed by over $10M of funding from well known global and Australian business and is expected to go through an IPO in 2019.


It is an exciting time to be joining the business and if you genuinely care about the state of the environment in Australia and globally, then this is a role you can be really passionate about and enjoy contributing towards the organisation's purpose.

\xa0

The hiring manager wants a Data Scientist with strong technical data query skills with SQL or a similar language, strong data modelling skills and preferably big data knowledge.


You will need to have previous leadership or managerial experience or be ready to step up and take on the extra responsibility of leading a team.

\xa0

The right person for this role needs to be passionate about data science and able to work on large data sets. You will be building predictive models and will have the freedom and flexibility to access large amounts of data.


This person will need to articulate insights to non-technical business people about the value of data in relation to their role. You will have regular stakeholder engagement and interaction with people across different business units.


An attractive salary package is on offer for this role and this is a collaborative, knowledge sharing working environment.

\xa0

The ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics and data science. If you regularly attend meet-ups, work on kaggle competitions and / or continue to develop your skills in data science outside of working hours, then we want to hear from you.


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE


  • Strong programming skills
  • Statistics skills
  • Data modelling skills
  • Data query skills
  • Able to visualise data and present
  • Desirable to have skills in Machine Learning and / or Artificial Intelligence
  • Worked with SQL, R, Python, SAS, AWS Redshift, Tableau or other similar tools
  • Desirable to have Big Data skills in tools like Hadoop and Spark
  • Leadership and managerial capability
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong stakeholder management skills
  • Passionate about data science


If the above sounds like you, please get in touch. We can wait for a notice period to be served and we are interviewing immediately.

Job description

Job Description

The Department of Health and Human Services develops and delivers policies, programs and services that support and enhance the wellbeing of all Victorians. Our services are in line with the government's vision for making Victoria a stronger, more caring and innovative state. Our vision is to achieve the best health, wellbeing and safety of all Victorians so that they can live a life they value. We are building an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity of backgrounds and differences to realise the potential of our employees for innovation and delivering services aimed at enhancing the lives of vulnerable Victorians. The department is committed to the safety of its clients. The department takes a zero tolerance approach to abuse, including child abuse and abuse of people with disability. Departmental employees are required to comply with all legal requirements including the Child Safe Standards to keep children safe from harm and abuse. All jobs can be worked flexibly and we encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, people with disabilities, LGBTI and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. If you want a career within a department striving to make Victoria the best place to be and helping shape communities we all want to be part of, then we encourage you to apply. If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander applicant, or if you have a disability, and require advice and support with the recruitment process, contact our Diversity Unit on DiversityInclusion@dhhs.vic.gov.au. The department has a zero tolerance towards violence within the workplace and recognises the rights of all staff to be free from violence and gender-related discrimination. We are proudly working with White Ribbon to create a safer workplace.

Number of vacancies available: x 1 ongoing, full time

Office Location(s): 50 Lonsdale St, Melbourne Vic 3000

Position Summary

Senior Analyst, Incident Problem and Known Error

The Senior Incident, Problem and Known Error (IPK) Analyst will provide specialist support across Health Technology Solutions (HTS) to the IPK processes aligned with the ITIL principles. Reporting to the Manager, Service Management, the Senior IPK Analyst is to share accountability for the effectiveness, maturity, ongoing enhancement and promotion of the HTS IPK processes and sub-processes to ensure they continue to derive value.

This position maintains responsibilities for the management of high priority incidents, problems and known errors; contributes to maturing quality processes, quality and compliance; management and implementation of actions identified in PIR processes and the communication of IPK status to internal and external stakeholders. Working in conjunction with HTS teams, this position is also responsible for overall IPK KPI's (Key Performance Indicators), noting that each HTS team retains responsibility for their individual application IPK KPI's.

Are You?
  • Experienced in managing IPK processes in an environment where shared services are delivered through highly complex inter-dependent systems and platforms?
  • Familiar in working in the end to end delivery of services from an IT Shared Services or Outsourcing environment operating within an ITIL framework?
  • Analytical, able to draw insight and capable of providing associated recommendations to senior management, as well as able to influence senior management and talk technically with technical experts?


How To Apply

Applicants are encouraged to apply online, submitting a cover letter and a current resume.

Please Note

For this role, you are not required to address each of the key selection criteria in a separate written document. Applicants are strongly encouraged to review our Careers Page .This page provides information on the department's recruitment and safety screening processes.

Click 'Apply Now' below to submit your interest in this role.

For further information please visit the Department of Health and Human Services website: https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/

Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.

Job description

About Us

UniSuper is one of Australia’s largest superannuation funds, and is run solely for the benefit of its members. For more than 34 years, UniSuper has been managing super for people employed in the higher education and research sector. UniSuper currently invests around $66 billion on behalf of 400,000 current and former higher education and research employees.

Our people are passionate not only about what we do but how we do it. Along with competitive superannuation products we strive to give our members the best from customer services through to an exceptional online experience.

About The Role

The Identity and Access Management Lead will be responsible for building and leading a team of IAM operations support personnel to deliver services across a number of IDAM technologies including Privilege Access Management (PAM), Identity & Access Management and Identity Governance and Assurance.IAM Lead will be responsible for creating the policies and procedures required to support a number of technologies.

As part of the Information Security team, the Identity and Access Management (IAM) Lead will be responsible for creating the Identity Management technology architecture for provisioning and removing access to UniSuper systems and applications.The position will collate the technical aspects of the identity and access management architecture and solutions necessary for the enterprise as a whole.The role will also be responsible for working with the rest of security function on developing the Identity and Account Management technology roadmap.

About You

The IAM Lead will have expertise in analysis, gathering requirements and specifications within UniSuper to design the Identity and Access Management (IAM) platform. The role will help other teams and projects to understand how to leverage enterprise IAM capabilities including IAM Governance and Provisioning, Federation Services, Directory Services and managing generic accounts.

Other key criteria includes;
  • Expertise in implementing industry leading Identity and Governance portfolio products.
  • Experience in implementing industry leading Identity federation products.
  • Expertise in Directory Services technologies such Microsoft Active Directory and its integration points via LDAP and Kerberos.
  • Foundation experience in Oracle Database and MS SQL Server.
  • Foundation experience in implementing WildFly, Tomcat, Oracle WebLogic or IBM WebSphere Application Server.
  • Thorough understanding of HTTP, XML and LDAP.
  • Understanding of the application of different Identity, Governance and Administration solution capabilities including user lifecycle management, RBAC design and implementation, Access Governance requirements and reporting, Multi-factor authentication, SSO, federated access, related cloud solutions.

What We Offer You

At UniSuper, we offer competitive salaries, flexible and diverse working environments, and have modern offices in the heart of the CBD.

We also offer a range of paid volunteer days to support charities, discounted gym membership schemes, seated massages and discounted movie tickets.

When you also include an additional 3 days paid leave over the Christmas and New Year period and a chance to work with a great team of people, we feel we have great environment.

If you feel you have the experience and skills required for this role, please apply!

The Department of Economic Development, Jobs, Transport and Resources (DEDJTR) is the Victorian Government’s lead agency for creating the conditions to sustainably develop the Victorian economy and grow employment. Our role is to increase jobs, investment, exports and opportunities; stimulate innovation, competitiveness, and confidence; and support sustainability.

The Department is committed to building a culture where we say 'yes' to flexible work arrangements, and support ways of working that help employees balance work and home life. The Department is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds.

The Department strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

The Department offers reasonable adjustments for applicants with disabilities on request.

SENIOR ADVISOR, LEADERSHIP AND MANAGER DEVELOPMENT

  • $95,275 - $115,276 (Plus Superannuation)
  • Fixed Term (12 months)
  • Usual hours of work: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
  • Usual work location: Melbourne, CBD (flexibility may be available)

The position of Senior Advisor, Leadership and Manager Development forms a part of the Leadership, Performance and Development Branch in People and Workplace Services Division within Corporate Services Group.

Corporate Services actively supports Ministers and DEDJTR portfolio groups to create the conditions for sustainable economic development and employment growth. The Group works collaboratively to deliver integrated and operational functions across the department, leading the development of governance, people, culture, systems and capability. Corporate Services deliver service excellence through collaboration with DEDJTR partners, stakeholders and clients.

It comprises Financial Management; Ministerial and Portfolio Services; People and Workplace Services; Strategic Procurement; Technology Services; Service Centre and Office of the Chief Corporate Strategy Officer.

The purpose of this role is to lead the development and implementation of strategies and initiatives for building and sustaining leadership capabilities and strong performance in people managers in DEDJTR. The role reports to the Manager, Performance and Development, within the People and Workplaces Services Division. To be successful in this role, the incumbent needs to apply their experience of managing leadership and manager development programs and initiatives, including demonstrating sound conceptual and analytical skills, interpersonal engagement skills (especially to internal and external stakeholders), innovative thinking, and advanced knowledge of learning and development practices.

For a confidential discussion, please call Caroline Nadj, Manager Leadership, Performance and Development on (03) 9208 3190.

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department.

For further information on the position, please see the attached position description. To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button below.

Applications close at midnight on 10 October 2018

Please Note: The generic online form may ask you to provide the responses to all of the KSC. At this step in the on-line process, please only upload your resume and cover letter (there is NO requirement to address all of the KSC) and move on to the last screen where you will be asked to submit responses to the specific questions only". Complete these specific questions to complete your application.

Job description

The VRRPI Team

Victoria Police is seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Project Manager to join its Victorian Equal Opportunity and Human Rights Commission (VEOHRC) Review Response, Partnerships and Innovation Office (VRRPI).

  • Leads and coordinates the implementation of the recommendations of the VEOHRC independent review into sexual harassment, including sexual discrimination and predatory behaviour, in Victoria Police.
  • Leads partnerships between Victoria Police and other agencies to establish more collaborative, holistic and innovative approaches to service delivery, harm reduction and harm prevention.

    • Your Duties Will Include

    Working closely with the Assistant Director of the VRRPI Office, you will lead business management processes to support the work of the team as it completes the coordination of the current VEOHRC recommendations, and prepares to transition the work into ongoing structures. This will involve budget management, coordination of business planning processes and development of new resource requirements. This role requires close collaboration with a range of stakeholders across Victoria Police.

    As The Successful Applicant, You Will Have
    • Demonstrated record of achievement at a senior level in successfully managing the implementation of complex large-scale projects in accordance with organisational frameworks and recognised project management methodologies.
    • Extensive senior project management experience in all elements of a project cycle including the development of detailed project plans, governance, reporting, implementation and post implementation reviews.
    • Extensive experience in the leadership, management and development of staff in a rapidly changing work environment involving large multi skilled client service delivery and processing functions.
    • Significant experience in effective people management and modelling behaviours in a large scale finance environment.
    • Demonstrated record of sound financial management to ensure corporate projects are delivered within agreed budget and strict timelines.
    • Highly developed interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills and demonstrated capacity to initiate and manage stakeholder relationships and expectations.


    Requirements And Relevant Information
    • Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa.

    • VPSG6 salary range, $116,863 - $156,387 p.a + super + leave loading* - *salary is pro-rata for part-time positions.


    Your Application Must Include
    • Resume,

Job description

About The Company

With over a decade of experience in the childcare sector, running various campuses under a number of different names, we re-branded in 2012 under the one name of Only About Children. We have over 60 Early Education and Preschool campuses for 0-5 year old children with many more in development throughout Sydney and Melbourne.

At Only About Children, we offer 21st century childcare to meet the needs of today's families. We focus on innovation, development, and passion for education. We invite curiosity, discovery and forward thinking.

About The Campus

Together with architects, Law Architects and Elsie+Betty, we have been able to create inspiring and exciting play and learning spaces built specifically for the development of nursery, toddler and preschool children. Highlights of this campus include;
Modern design with high ceilings, natural light and extensive use of wood and glass.
Set over three stories with separate state of the art learning and play environments
for nursery, toddler and kindergarten aged children.
Two very large outdoor play spaces with a handcrafted tree-house, bike track, water play and river bed , sandpits and a sports court drenched in morning and afternoon sunlight.
Private Nursery with sleeping cot rooms, cot linen, nappies, bottles and formula.
Campus Cook and onsite kitchen serving breakfast, lunch, and snacks
Caf\xe9 style dining for children

About The Role

We are looking for a Diploma Qualified educator to lead our 2.5-3 year pre kinder room. Licensed to 28 children in the room we have a group of very dedicated educators supporting the children and families in the room.

Essential Requirements
  • Completed Diploma of Children's Services/ECEC with a strong understanding of the National Quality Framework and EYLF with proven results
  • Experience as a room leader with over 3 year olds, or similar role with proven results
  • A dynamic personality, creativity and a clear passion for early childhood education
  • Ability to think "outside the square" - we push boundaries and challenge the norm!
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A cooperative team player who loves and respects children in all their individuality and developmental stages
  • Commitment to excellence in early childhood
  • Ability to lead, mentor, and support the team
If This Is You, Then We'd Love To
